strengths: Validation pipeline is genuinely comprehensive: 8 validators in validate.ts (831 lines) covering every data boundary -- AgentEvaluation, SynthesisReport, ProjectState, Timeline, ActionItemsLedger, TryPanelResult, TryResult, plus SynthesisComposite. Wired into both server (audit-loader.ts) and client (usePanelStream.ts line 253), creating a real two-sided validation boundary. iter-8 P1 (wire validateAgentEvaluation) confirmed resolved at route.ts line 194.

Fix pipeline architecture (SKILL.md + fix-lead.md + fix-worker.md) is the cleanest decomposition in the project: thin launcher that reads data and spawns teams, orchestrator that handles dependency analysis + batch planning + retry queues, focused workers that touch exactly one item. Two-attempt maximum with revert-on-failure prevents unbounded loops.

Compound learning is demonstrably working: 58 action items tracked, 55 resolved, 2 in_progress. Score trajectory from 68.4 to 83.51 across 9 iterations. Cross-iteration context wired via try-prompt.ts buildCrossIterationContext feeding prior scores into subsequent evaluations.
weaknesses: route.ts at 574 lines is still a monolith. iter-8 P3 (extract agent invocation logic) remains unresolved -- no try-invoke.ts exists. Agent invocation, synthesis, debate, and fallback logic all inlined in a single POST handler.
No RSC smoke tests exist (iter-8 P5 still open). MEMORY.md warns 'Build succeeding does NOT mean pages work' but zero test coverage for any page.tsx or layout.tsx.
Fallback paths in route.ts use unsafe type assertions (lines 214-245, 486-535) that bypass the validation system the project built.

action_items.action: Extract agent invocation, debate, synthesis, and fallback logic from route.ts into separate modules (try-invoke.ts, try-debate.ts, try-synthesize.ts).
action_items.impact: Reduces route.ts from 574 to ~150 lines. Two iterations flagged. Architecture +3-5.

action_items.action: Add 3-5 RSC smoke tests covering landing page, results page, and results/[auditId] page.
action_items.impact: Closes the documented rendering blind spot. Verification +3-4.

action_items.action: Replace unsafe fallback type assertions in route.ts with a buildAgentResultFromPartialData helper using field-by-field validation.
action_items.impact: Eliminates type safety gap. Verification +2, simplicity +2.

agents.one_line: The validation pipeline and compound learning loop are legitimately strong -- 8 validators wired at every boundary, 55/58 action items resolved across 9 iterations -- but route.ts remains a 574-line monolith that should have been decomposed two iterations ago.

strengths: Try-It-Now zero-install flow (HeroTrySection -> TryPageClient -> /api/try/route.ts) delivers value in under 60 seconds with zero signup, zero install, zero configuration. Best product decision in the codebase.
Narrative ('We Didn't Get a Spot. So We Built the Judges.' in messages.ts line 20) is genuinely memorable and emotionally resonant. The story section converts rejection into creative origin story.
Tiered BYOK architecture (github.ts getTierLimits, try-agents.ts getModelId) creates smooth upgrade path. Free=Haiku/80KB, BYOK=Opus+Sonnet/400KB. Progressive disclosure done right.
weaknesses: No dashboard/README.md (iter-8 P2 still open). Developer cloning the repo has no guidance on env vars (ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, KV_REST_API_URL, KV_REST_API_TOKEN).
Landing page has no visual representation of the audit-fix-re-audit loop (iter-8 P3 still open). The closed-loop improvement story is buried in a feature card.
No guidance on API key acquisition or cost (iter-8 P4 still open). BYOK conversion suffers from information asymmetry.

action_items.action: Add visual audit-fix-re-audit loop section to landing page showing score progression with before/after visualization.
action_items.impact: Narrative +3-5. Makes the product's core differentiator visible.

action_items.action: Add cost guidance and API key signup link to BYOK flow in TryForm.tsx.
action_items.impact: Adoption path +3-4. Higher BYOK conversion.

action_items.action: Create dashboard/README.md documenting env vars and local setup.
action_items.impact: Adoption path +2-3 for contributors and self-hosters.

agents.one_line: Zero-install Try It Now flow delivers the aha moment in under 60 seconds with a memorable narrative, but the closed-loop improvement story needs hero-level treatment on the landing page.

strengths: Tier-aware file selection is a genuine capability unlock -- getTierLimits() in github.ts gives BYOK users 400KB/40 files versus 80KB/10 for free. Real model-capability alignment that makes BYOK worthwhile.

Cross-iteration context creates genuine compound intelligence -- pipeline queries Redis for previous reviews, builds context with prior scores and action items, appends to user prompt. Repeat evaluations get smarter over time.

Adaptive thinking budgets in EFFORT_BUDGET_MAP correctly calibrate cognitive effort per agent (max=20000 for deep analysis, low=2000 for straightforward evaluation). Combined with conditional thinking enablement only for BYOK Opus agents.
weaknesses: Debate still runs on Sonnet for BYOK users -- route.ts line 306 hardcodes getModelId('sonnet', tier). The most intellectually demanding task runs on a less capable model. Flagged in iter-8 P3, unchanged.

Agents remain entirely single-turn text generators with zero tool access. No tools parameter in any client.messages.create() call. The fix pipeline shows real agent architecture, but the web evaluation pipeline hasn't caught up.

1M context window better utilized at 400KB for BYOK (5x improvement) but still only 40% of capacity. File fetching is serial with no parallelism. No mechanism for agents to request files beyond initial selection.

action_items.action: Upgrade debate model to Opus for BYOK tier: change route.ts line 306 from getModelId('sonnet', tier) to getModelId('opus', tier).
action_items.impact: emergent_behavior +5. One-line fix, two iterations flagged.

action_items.action: Add tool_use capability for at least one agent (boris or thariq) to request additional file contents mid-evaluation.
action_items.impact: ai_innovation +8, emergent_behavior +5. Moves from single-turn to genuine agentic behavior.

action_items.action: Parallelize file fetching in github.ts using Promise.all with concurrency limiter. Add language-specific file scoring bonuses.
action_items.impact: efficiency +3, opus_usage +3.

agents.one_line: Meaningful progress on tier-aware context and cross-iteration memory, but debate model and tool access remain unresolved -- the fix pipeline shows what real agent architecture looks like, the web pipeline hasn't caught up.

strengths: useReducer refactor in usePanelStream.ts is textbook -- PanelStreamState interface paired with 11-variant PanelStreamAction discriminated union. Every state transition is explicit, auditable, and type-safe. Replaced 7 useState calls, eliminating impossible state combinations.

TypeScript configuration is exemplary: strict:true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, noImplicitReturns. Zero any types across entire src/. types.ts uses 'as const satisfies' for AGENT_COLORS, tuple types, union literals. TypeScript done right.

Centralized UI strings in messages.ts (389 lines) with 'as const' assertion is excellent DX foresight -- ready for i18n. Combined with ui-constants.ts extracting shared style maps, creates single source of truth for all UI tokens.
weaknesses: Evaluation list pattern still duplicated across 4 files (iter-8 P3 still open). PanelAgentCard.tsx, PanelSynthesisView.tsx, StreamingAgentCard.tsx, and results/web/[auditId]/page.tsx all render the same strengths/weaknesses pattern with slight variations. AgentCard.tsx already has clean ListSection that none use.

Index-as-key anti-pattern persists in dynamic list content. PanelAgentCard.tsx key={i} at lines 184/204/223 for AI-generated strings that change between renders during streaming. PanelSynthesisView.tsx lines 84/115 same issue.

SSE event handler in usePanelStream.ts uses 'as string' and 'as TryAgentResult' assertions without runtime validation. Complete event correctly uses validateTryPanelResult, but individual agent_complete events trust the server blindly.

action_items.action: Extract shared EvaluationList component from AgentCard ListSection pattern. Use in PanelAgentCard, PanelSynthesisView, StreamingAgentCard, and web/[auditId] page.
action_items.impact: Eliminates ~120 lines duplicated JSX. code_quality +2, patterns +2. Three iterations flagged.

action_items.action: Replace key={i} with content-derived keys in dynamic lists. Use key={s} for strengths/weaknesses strings, key={item.priority} for action items.
action_items.impact: Fixes reconciliation correctness for streaming content. code_quality +1.

action_items.action: Add lightweight type narrowing guard for SSE data in usePanelStream.ts instead of assertion casts.
action_items.impact: Runtime safety for streaming protocol. code_quality +1.

agents.one_line: The useReducer state machine is genuinely excellent, TypeScript strictness is pristine with zero any types, and centralized messages/constants show real DX maturity -- but evaluation list duplication has spread to four files and needs extraction.

strengths: Outstanding README.md with animated SVG quickstart demo showing 3-step audit-fix-reaudit flow with score progression. Exactly what a developer needs to see value in under 30 seconds.

Excellent accessibility implementation: skip-to-content link in layout.tsx, ARIA progressbars in AgentCard.tsx, role='img' on RadarChart.tsx, useReducedMotion in all animated components. Focus-visible styling across 19 files.

Complete community infrastructure: CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant 2.1), GitHub issue templates, PR template with accessibility checklist, MIT LICENSE. Genuinely ready for external contributors.
weaknesses: No API documentation for slash commands beyond individual command files. No consolidated command index or searchable reference.
Installation UX has friction: README shows 3 different install options with no clear recommendation. Option 3 (plugin registry) listed but unavailable.
Missing OG image for social sharing. No opengraph-image.tsx, so social shares have no preview image.

action_items.action: Create dashboard/src/app/opengraph-image.tsx with a 1200x630 image showing BoardClaude logo, tagline, and radar chart.
action_items.impact: Social shares get rich previews, ~3x click-through improvement.

action_items.action: Add consolidated command reference table at commands/README.md or COMMANDS.md.
action_items.impact: documentation +3. Scan all commands in 10 seconds.

action_items.action: Simplify README install: make install.sh the ONLY recommended path. Move manual steps to CONTRIBUTING.md.
action_items.impact: onboarding +2. Eliminates decision paralysis.

agents.one_line: DevRel gold -- animated quickstart demo, comprehensive a11y, full community infrastructure, 106 passing tests, and an install script that just works.

strengths: Narrative clarity is outstanding -- README delivers a one-sentence pitch, compelling origin story, and demonstrates value through 9 audit iterations showing 68.4 to 84+ progression. Quickstart SVG is brilliant non-technical storytelling.

Production infrastructure is enterprise-grade -- Upstash Redis persistence, tier-aware rate limiting, 831 lines of validation, graceful error handling, OG tags for social sharing. Deployed at boardclaude.com with GitHub auto-deploy.
Accessibility infrastructure is comprehensive -- 72 instances of focus-visible/aria-*/role patterns, useReducedMotion in critical components, skip-to-content, ARIA progressbars, keyboard navigation.
weaknesses: Internationalization is still hardcoded English -- messages.ts centralizes strings but no i18n library wired. No RTL awareness, no plural forms, no message interpolation.
Community onboarding has friction -- install.sh requires git clone of entire repo. No npm/npx installable package, no plugin registry entry.
Error messages lack actionable recovery paths -- generic messages like 'Failed to load audit results' without differentiating missing dir vs permissions vs malformed JSON.

action_items.action: Add error recovery hints: when .boardclaude/ missing show 'Run /bc:init'; when rate-limited show upgrade path; differentiate 404 vs private vs network errors.
action_items.impact: production_readiness +3-5.

action_items.action: Create npx boardclaude install command for one-command setup.
action_items.impact: community_impact +8-12. Biggest adoption blocker.

action_items.action: Add i18n-ready message interpolation and pluralization helper. Document i18n roadmap in CONTRIBUTING.md.
action_items.impact: Signals global readiness. Integration +10-15.

agents.one_line: Outstanding narrative and production infrastructure, but internationalization is planned-not-executed and onboarding friction remains the biggest adoption barrier.

top_strengths: Validation pipeline is comprehensive and wired at every data boundary (Boris, Lydia, Jason agree) -- 8 validators, validateAgentEvaluation now in route.ts, validateTryPanelResult in usePanelStream and try-storage
useReducer state machine in usePanelStream replaces 7 useState calls with an explicit, type-safe 11-variant discriminated union -- textbook React pattern (Lydia, Boris agree)
Try-It-Now zero-install flow delivers value in under 60 seconds with compelling narrative, tier-aware BYOK upgrade path, and persistent shareable results via Redis (Cat, Jason, Ado agree)
Community infrastructure is genuinely ready: CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md, issue templates, PR template with a11y checklist, animated quickstart SVG demo (Ado, Jason agree)
Compound learning is working: 55/58 action items resolved across 9 iterations, cross-iteration context wired into web reviews, score trajectory from 68.4 to 83.51 (Boris)
top_weaknesses: route.ts at 574 lines remains a monolith -- agent invocation, debate, synthesis, and fallback logic should be extracted into separate modules (Boris, Thariq, 2 iterations flagged)
Evaluation list pattern duplicated across 4 components without shared abstraction -- ~120 lines of identical JSX (Lydia, 3 iterations flagged)

Debate runs on Sonnet even for BYOK users, and agents have zero tool access -- the most demanding reasoning task uses a weaker model, agents remain single-turn text generators (Thariq, 2 iterations flagged)
Three Cat action items still open from iter-8: no dashboard/README.md, no visual loop section on landing page, no BYOK cost guidance
Index-as-key anti-pattern in dynamic AI-generated lists during streaming (Lydia, Boris)

divergent_opinions.summary: Thariq scores 74.35 seeing fundamental limitations (single-turn agents, Sonnet debate, no tool access); Lydia scores 87.95 seeing exemplary code quality and patterns. They evaluate different facets of the same system.

Cat scores 86.3 seeing a product that delivers genuine value with zero-install flow; Thariq scores 74.35 wanting deeper AI capabilities. The product works well but could leverage more of Opus 4.6's capabilities.

improvements: Route.ts decomposed from 574-line monolith into 3 focused modules (try-invoke, try-debate, try-synthesize)
Cross-iteration context confirmed working (Thariq recognized prior review data)
EvaluationList component extracted, reducing duplication across 4 files
regressions: Thariq score still lowest at 74.35 despite improvement (+3.05 from iter-8)
No landing page visual for audit-fix loop (addressed in this fix cycle)
